ITrackball

Defines the interface to our trackball implementation

Header

import Rendering.Caustic.ITrackball

Functions
BeginTracking
virtual void BeginTracking(
int 
screenX,
int 
screenY,
int 
screenW,
int 
screenH
) = 0

Called to start tracking

Parameters
screenX
int

mouse's X position where tracking starts in pixels

screenY
int

mouse's Y position where tracking starts in pixels

screenW
int

width of the window in pixels

screenH
int

height of the window in pixels

virtual bool UpdateTracking(
int 
screenX,
int 
screenY,
ETrackballConstraint 
constraint,
DirectX::
XMMATRIX 
*
pMatrix
) = 0

Called when mouse moves during trackball tracking

Parameters
screenX
int

current mouse's X position

screenY
int

current mouse's Y position

constraint
ETrackballConstraint

current constraint

pMatrix
DirectX::XMMATRIX*

Resulting trackball matrix

EndTracking
virtual void EndTracking() = 0

Called when mouse is released during trackball tracking

CreateTrackball
CRefObj<ITrackball> CreateTrackball()

Global function for creating a track ball. This method should generally not be called. Use the ICausticFactory to create new Caustic objects.

Returns

Returns the newly created trackball.
